results.firPara: Lewisham councils plan to compulsorily purchase Millwall FCs land around The Den and sell it to mystery offshore-owned developers took a further unlikely twist in courtroom five of the Employment Appeal Tribunal.
results.secPara: The council, represented by a QC and instructing solicitors, successfully argued behind closed doors that the hearing should be postponed until January. The reason for the delay is the unavailability of one of the directors of the developers, Renewal, who would have given evidence.
results.webTitle: Controversial Millwall FC development plans hearing postponed till January

results.firPara: Luis Enrique has denied any knowledge of speculation linking Lionel Messi with Manchester City. Messi is expected to return to the Barcelona team for the Champions League match against Celtic in Glasgow on Wednesday, having missed the weekend draw against Málaga through illness.
results.secPara: Reports have suggested City are ready to move for Messi. I dont know. I have no idea, the Barcelona manager said curtly. Lionel is always ready to play and Im sure he will be ready to face Celtic. He is 100% and eager to give the best version of himself.
results.webTitle: Luis Enrique gives Lionel Messi to Manchester City rumours short shrift

results.firPara: Bruce Arena has been confirmed as the new coach of the US national team. The LA Galaxy coach replaces Jürgen Klinsmann, who was fired on Monday.
results.secPara: Arena, widely regarded as one of the best coaches in American history, returns for his second spell as national team boss, having taken charge of USA between 1998 and 2006. He will take up his new role on 1 December.
results.webTitle: US Soccer confirms Bruce Arena will replace Jürgen Klinsmann

results.firPara: Today Big Cup, Zlatan humility (part 326) and stadium sleepovers
results.secPara: Today Big Cup, Zlatan humility (part 326) and stadium sleepovers
results.webTitle: Phil Jones gurning at himself in a mirror

results.firPara: The Galaxy coach will replace Jürgen Klinsmann. But if he is a stop gap until 2018, who are the long-term candidates?
results.secPara: Lets get the obvious out of the way — Bruce Arena is the USA coach until at least the 2018 World Cup.
results.webTitle: Bruce Arena a solid option for US Soccer but how about Herrera in the long-term?

results.firPara: Steve Walters, a prodigiously talented midfielder, became Crewe Alexandras youngest debutant in 1988. Having read the account of club-mate Andy Woodward in the Guardian last week, he now feels empowered to tell his own harrowing story
results.secPara: Steve Walters, a prodigiously talented midfielder, became Crewe Alexandras youngest debutant in 1988. Having read the account of club-mate Andy Woodward in the Guardian last week, he now feels empowered to tell his own harrowing story
results.webTitle: Second footballer reveals abuse by serial paedophile Barry Bennell

results.firPara: Paris Saint Germain defender Serge Aurier has been refused permission by British authorities to travel to England for Wednesdays Champions League match against Arsenal.
results.secPara: The French club announced that Aurier, a 23-year-old Ivory Coast international, had been denied an entry visa because of an assault conviction he received in September for acting violently towards police outside a nightclub.
results.webTitle: PSG 'stunned' as Serge Aurier barred from entering Britain for Arsenal clash

results.firPara: • Manager appeared riled when asked about the Chileans fitness
results.secPara: • Manager appeared riled when asked about the Chileans fitness
results.webTitle: Arsène Wenger insists playing Sánchez at Manchester United was not a risk

results.firPara: The Everton Under-23 manager, David Unsworth, has signed his entire squad up to take part in a sleepout at Goodison Park in aid of a homeless charity.
results.secPara: Everton in the Community (EitC) have organised the Goodison Sleepout on 25 November to raise money for vulnerable people across Liverpool. The under-23s will be joined by fans and business partners in sleeping in the Park End Stand.
results.webTitle: Everton Under-23s to sleep rough at Goodison Park for homeless charity

results.firPara: The Colombian provoked little but pity in his two seasons in the Premier League but with seven goals in nine games there are traces of a renaissance at Monaco
results.secPara: It was not just a successful substitution, it was a sign of a broader transformation. On a rainy night at Lorient last Friday Monaco were struggling to break down Ligue 1s bottom team, who were uncharacteristically defiant under their new manager, Bernard Casoni. So after 63 minutes Leonardo Jardim introduced Radamel Falcao from the bench. With his first touch the Colombia striker scored. The floodgates opened and Monaco went home with a 3-0 win that sent them top of the table. It was Falcaos fifth goal in his past three matches, his seventh in the nine he has played so far in a season in which he is re-emerging, at last, as a forward to fear. Tottenham Hotspur have been warned.
results.webTitle: Tottenham must halt Falcao’s revival to keep Champions League hopes alive | Paul Doyle
